contentrichtext.text: {{other places|Sułkowice}} {{Infobox settlement | name = Sułkowice | image_flag = POL Sułkowice flag.svg | image_shield = POL Sułkowice COA new.svg | pushpin_map = Poland | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Lesser Poland Voivodeship|Lesser Poland]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Myślenice County|Myślenice]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Sułkowice|Sułkowice]] | area_total_km2 = 16.46 | population_as_of = 2006 | population_total = 6305 | population_density_km2 = auto | latd = 49 | latm = 50 | lats = 16 | latNS = N | longd = 19 | longm = 47 | longs = 44 | longEW = E | elevation_m = | postal_code_type = Postal code | postal_code = 32-440 | website = http://www.sulkowice.pl }} '''Sułkowice''' {{IPAc-pl|s|u|U|k|o|'|w|J|i|c|e}} is a town in southern [[Poland]], situated in the [[Lesser Poland Voivodeship]] (since 1999), previously in [[Kraków Voivodeship]] (1975–1998). The current mayor of Sulkowice is Piotr Pulka (elected 2006). == Sports == * [[Meble-Rys Goscibia Sulkowice|Meble-Ryś Gościbia Sułkowice]] - women's [[Handball in Poland|handball]] team playing in [[Polish Ekstraklasa Women's Handball League]]: 12th place in 2003/2004 season; will play in the 1st league in 2004/2005 season. ==Outside cords == * [http://www.sulkowice.info Sułkowice.info] * [http://www.sztetl.org.pl/en/city/sulkowice/ Jewish Community in Sułkowice] on Virtual Shtetl <br> {{Gmina Sułkowice}} {{coord|49|51|N|19|48|E|region:PL_type:city(6288)_source:dewiki|display=title}} [http://www.sulkowice.info/] {{DEFAULTSORT:Sulkowice}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Lesser Poland Voivodeship]] [[Category:Myślenice County]] {{LesserPoland-geo-stub}}
